meanings.definition: A person or company that sells goods for retail.
meanings.sent1: The merchandiser at the store helped customers find the perfect products.
meanings.sent2: The merchandiser stocked the shelves with new items for the upcoming sale.
meanings.sent3: The merchandiser decided to play a game with customers to boost sales.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a merchandiser, attracting shoppers to the display.
meanings.sent5: The merchandiser's knowledge of the products was impressive and helpful.

meanings.definition: A display or arrangement of goods for sale in a store.
meanings.sent1: The colorful merchandiser in the window caught the attention of passersby.
meanings.sent2: The store manager rearranged the merchandiser to showcase the new collection.
meanings.sent3: The playful merchandiser in the toy section made kids excited to shop.
meanings.sent4: The holiday-themed merchandiser transformed the store into a festive wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The elegant merchandiser highlighted the luxury items beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of promoting and selling products.
meanings.sent1: Effective merchandising involves creating appealing product displays.
meanings.sent2: The success of the campaign relied on strategic merchandising techniques.
meanings.sent3: The comedic merchandising pitch had customers laughing and buying.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for merchandising shone through in every sales presentation.
meanings.sent5: The art of merchandising requires a good understanding of consumer behavior.
